intro: Leucospora coahuilensis, commonly known as the Coahuila leucospora, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its small, white flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
